maml:description.maml:para: Copy a file from its raw bytes on disk.

The Copy-FileRaw cmdlet parses the Master File Table to determine the location of the specified file's data/contents. The raw bytes are then copied to the location specified by the Destination parameter. This cmdlet bypasses NTFS Permissions and Operating System locks.
The file to copy.
Where the file is to be copied.
The file to copy.
Where the file is to be copied.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
Copy-Item C:\Windows\System32\config\SAM C:\Users\Public\Desktop\SAM
Copy-Item : The process cannot access the file 'C:\Windows\System32\config\SAM' because it is being used by another process. At line:1 char:1 + Copy-Item C:\Windows\System32\config\SAM C:\Users\Public\Desktop\SAM + ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ + CategoryInfo : NotSpecified: (:) [Copy-Item], IOException + FullyQualifiedErrorId : System.IO.IOException,Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands.CopyItemCommand
Copy-FileRaw C:\Windows\System32\config\SAM C:\Users\Public\Desktop\SAM

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example copied the SAM Registry hive (a locked file) to the Public user's desktop. It also showed that this file cannot be copied by the Copy-Item cmdlet.

maml:description.maml:para: Returns information about all the MFT file attributes usable in a volume.
The Get-AttrDef cmdlet parses the $AttrDef file on the specified volume, and returns information about all MFT file attributes usable in the volume.
The name of the Volume or Logical Partition (Ex. \\.\C:, \\.\HARDDISKVOLUME1, or C).
The name of the Volume or Logical Partition (Ex. \\.\C:, \\.\HARDDISKVOLUME1, or C).

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
Get-AttrDef -VolumeName \\.\C:
Name : $STANDARD_INFORMATION Type : 16 Flags : Always Resident MaxSize : 48 MinSize : 72
Name : $ATTRIBUTE_LIST Type : 32 Flags : Always Non-Resident MaxSize : 0 MinSize : 18446744073709551615
Name : $FILE_NAME Type : 48 Flags : Always Resident MaxSize : 68 MinSize : 578

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example shows returning the MFT Attribute definitions for the C Volume.

maml:description.maml:para: Returns the content of a file from the file's raw bytes on disk.

The Get-ContentRaw cmdlet parses the Master File Table to determine the location of the specified file's data/contents. The raw bytes are then read and output using the specified encoding. This cmdlet bypasses NTFS Permissions and Operating System locks.
Specifies the path to a file. Get-ContentRaw gets the content of the file. The parameter name ("Path" or "FilePath") is optional.

command:parameter.maml:name: Encoding

maml:description.maml:para: Specifies the encoding to use when outputing the file's contents. Encoding options include ASCII, BigEndianUnicode, Bye, String, Unicode, Unknown, UTF7, and UTF8.

command:parameter.command:parameterValue: FileSystemCmdletProviderEncoding {Unknown | String | Unicode | Byte | BigEndianUnicode | UTF8 | UTF7 | Ascii | Default}

maml:description.maml:para:
Gets the specified number of lines from the beginning of a file or other item. The default is -1 (all lines).
You can use the "TotalCount" parameter name or its aliases, "First" or "Head".

Gets the specified number of lines from the end of a file or other item.
You can use the "Tail" parameter name or its alias, "Last".
The name of the Logical Volume where the file is located. (Ex. \\.\C: or C)
The file's MFT Record Index number.

command:parameter.maml:name: Encoding

maml:description.maml:para: Specifies the encoding to use when outputing the file's contents. Encoding options include ASCII, BigEndianUnicode, Bye, String, Unicode, Unknown, UTF7, and UTF8.

command:parameter.command:parameterValue: FileSystemCmdletProviderEncoding {Unknown | String | Unicode | Byte | BigEndianUnicode | UTF8 | UTF7 | Ascii | Default}

maml:description.maml:para:
Gets the specified number of lines from the beginning of a file or other item. The default is -1 (all lines).
You can use the "TotalCount" parameter name or its aliases, "First" or "Head".

Gets the specified number of lines from the end of a file or other item.
You can use the "Tail" parameter name or its alias, "Last".
Specifies the path to a file. Get-ContentRaw gets the content of the file. The parameter name ("Path" or "FilePath") is optional.

command:parameter.maml:name: Encoding

maml:description.maml:para: Specifies the encoding to use when outputing the file's contents. Encoding options include ASCII, BigEndianUnicode, Bye, String, Unicode, Unknown, UTF7, and UTF8.

command:parameter.command:parameterValue: FileSystemCmdletProviderEncoding {Unknown | String | Unicode | Byte | BigEndianUnicode | UTF8 | UTF7 | Ascii | Default}

maml:description.maml:para:
Gets the specified number of lines from the beginning of a file or other item. The default is -1 (all lines).
You can use the "TotalCount" parameter name or its aliases, "First" or "Head".

Gets the specified number of lines from the end of a file or other item.
You can use the "Tail" parameter name or its alias, "Last".
The name of the Logical Volume where the file is located. (Ex. \\.\C: or C)
The file's MFT Record Index number.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example outputs the content of the SAM registry hive using Unicode encoding.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
Get-ContentRaw -Path C:\Windows\DtcInstall.log -TotalCount 3
08-22-2013 00:18 : DTC Install error = 0, Enter MsDtcAdvancedInstaller::Configure, base\wcp\plugi ns\msdtc\msdtcadvancedinstaller\msdtcadvancedinstaller.cpp (419) 08-22-2013 00:18 : DTC Install error = 0, Action: None, base\wcp\plugins\msdtc\msdtcadvancedinsta ller\msdtcadvancedinstaller.cpp (448) 08-22-2013 00:18 : DTC Install error = 0, Entering CreateXATmSecurityKeyCNG, base\wcp\plugins\msd tc\msdtcadvancedinstaller\msdtcadvancedinstaller.cpp (1758)

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example outputs the first 3 lines of the DtcInstall.log file.
This example outputs the contents of the MFT file itself (the MFT is located at MFT Index 0) using the Default character encoding (ASCII on en-US systems).

maml:description.maml:para: Returns statistics about the specified volume's file system.
The Get-FileSystemStatistic cmdlet gets the NTFS_VOLUME_DATA_BUFFER structure from calling the DeviceIOControl Win32 API function, and creates a NTFSVolumeData object.
The name of the Volume or Logical Partition (Ex. \\.\C:, \\.\HARDDISKVOLUME1, or C).
The name of the Volume or Logical Partition (Ex. \\.\C:, \\.\HARDDISKVOLUME1, or C).

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
Get-FileSystemStatistic -VolumeName \\.\C:
VolumeSize_MB : 61437 TotalSectors : 125825023 TotalClusters : 15728127 FreeClusters : 8901834 FreeSpace_MB : 26665 BytesPerSector : 512 BytesPerCluster : 4096 BytesPerMFTRecord : 1024 ClustersPerMFTRecord : 0 MFTSize_MB : 185 MFTSize : 194772992 MFTStartCluster : 786432 MFTZoneClusterStart : 833984 MFTZoneClusterEnd : 837664 MFTZoneSize : 15073280 MFTMirrorStart : 2

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example shows the file system statistics of the C logical volume.

maml:description.maml:para: Returns a hash of the specified file.
The Get-Hash cmdlet returns a cryptographic hash value for the specified file. The hashing algorithm is specified by the Algorithm parameter.
The path of the file to be hashed.

command:parameter.maml:name: Algorithm

maml:description.maml:para: The hashing algorithm to use. Default algorithm is MD5.

command:parameter.command:parameterValue: String { MD5 | RIPEMD160 | SHA1 | SHA256 | SHA384 | SHA512 }

maml:description.maml:para: The count of bytes to be included when hashing. Default value is the entire file.
The path of the file to be hashed.

command:parameter.maml:name: Algorithm

maml:description.maml:para: The hashing algorithm to use. Default algorithm is MD5.

command:parameter.command:parameterValue: String { MD5 | RIPEMD160 | SHA1 | SHA256 | SHA384 | SHA512 }

maml:description.maml:para: The count of bytes to be included when hashing. Default value is the entire file.
Get-Hash outputs a System.String object representing the hash created by the specified algorithm.
Gets the MBR boot code

The Get-MBR cmdlet returns an MBR object containing the boot code within the Master Boot Record. Additionally, the cmdlet checks the MBR boot code for any unauthorized alterations that may be typical of MBR bootkits.
Specifies a path for the physical drive in the system. (Ex. \\.\PHYSICALDRIVE0)
Specifies a path for the physical drive in the system. (Ex. \\.\PHYSICALDRIVE0)

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example shows Get-MBR being used to return the MBR object from \\.\PHYSICALDRIVE0. In this case the MBRCodeArea is the standard Windows proprietary boot code.

maml:description.maml:para: Get a specific Attribute from an MFT Record.
The Get-MFTAttribute cmdlet allows the user to specify what type of attribute to return based on AttirbuteId.
The name of the Volume or Logical Partition (Ex. \\.\C:, \\.\HARDDISKVOLUME1, or C).
Get attributes from the MFT Record at the specified index.
Gets the Attribute that corresponds with the Id.
Returns the MFT Record Attribute as Raw Bytes instead of an Attr object.
The name of the Volume or Logical Partition (Ex. \\.\C:, \\.\HARDDISKVOLUME1, or C).
Get attributes from the MFT Record at the specified index.
Gets the Attribute that corresponds with the Id.
Returns the MFT Record Attribute as Raw Bytes instead of an Attr object.
Parses the Master File Table and returns MFTRecord objects.
The Get-MFTRecord cmdlet parses the Master File Table and returns the specified MFT Record. If a specific record is not given, Get-MFTRecord will return all MFT Records.
The name of the Volume or Logical Partition (Ex. \\.\C:, \\.\HARDDISKVOLUME1, or C).
The name of the Volume or Logical Partition (Ex. \\.\C:, \\.\HARDDISKVOLUME1, or C).
The MFT Record Index Number for the MFT Record that will be returned.
Returns the MFT Record as Raw Bytes instead of an MFTRecord object.
The name of the Volume or Logical Partition (Ex. \\.\C:, \\.\HARDDISKVOLUME1, or C).
The Path of the FileRecord object that will be returned.
Returns the MFT Record as Raw Bytes instead of an MFTRecord object.
The name of the Volume or Logical Partition (Ex. \\.\C:, \\.\HARDDISKVOLUME1, or C).
The MFT Record Index Number for the MFT Record that will be returned.
Returns the MFT Record as Raw Bytes instead of an MFTRecord object.
The Path of the FileRecord object that will be returned.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example shows Get-MFTRecord returning every MFT Record on the C drive, and storing the objects to the variable "records".

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
Get-MFTRecord -VolumeName \\.\C: -Path C:\Windows\system32\cmd.exe
FullPath : C:\Windows\System32\cmd.exe Name : cmd.exe ParentIndex : 6323 RecordNumber : 32349 Size : 480 AccessTime : 8/21/2013 9:54:00 PM BornTime : 8/21/2013 9:54:00 PM ChangeTime : 8/21/2013 9:54:00 PM MFTChangeTime : 9/9/2014 6:56:27 PM Permission : 32 SequenceNumber : 1 LogFileSequenceNumber : 203284893 Links : 2 Deleted : False Directory : False Attribute : {STANDARD_INFORMATION, FILE_NAME, FILE_NAME, OBJECT_ID...}

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example shows Get-MFTRecord returning the MFTRecord object representing cmd.exe.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 3 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
Get-MFTRecord -VolumeName C -Index 0
FullPath : C:\$MFT Name : $MFT ParentIndex : 5 RecordNumber : 0 Size : 408 AccessTime : 9/9/2014 9:45:08 PM BornTime : 9/9/2014 9:45:08 PM ChangeTime : 9/9/2014 9:45:08 PM MFTChangeTime : 9/9/2014 9:45:08 PM Permission : 6 SequenceNumber : 1 LogFileSequenceNumber : 1532490384 Links : 1 Deleted : False Directory : False Attribute : {STANDARD_INFORMATION, FILE_NAME, DATA, BITMAP}

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example show Get-MFTRecord returning the MFT record for the file whose index is 0 ($MFT).

maml:description.maml:para: Returns the MFT Record Index for the specified file.
The Get-MFTRecordIndex cmdlet returns the Master File Table Record Index Number for the specified file.
The path of the file of which to get the MFT Record Index.
The path of the file of which to get the MFT Record Index.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example shows Get-MFTRecordIndex returning the Master File Table Record Index for C:\Windows\Notepad.exe.

maml:description.maml:para: Returns a list of partition objects on the specified disk.
The Get-PartitionTable cmdlet returns one or more Partition objects depending on the specified DrivePath.
Specifies a path for the physical drive in the system. (Ex. \\.\PHYSICALDRIVE0)
Specifies a path for the physical drive in the system. (Ex. \\.\PHYSICALDRIVE0)

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
Get-PartitionTable -DrivePath \\.\PHYSICALDRIVE0
Bootable SystemID StartSector EndSector -------- -------- ----------- --------- True NTFS 2048 125827072

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example returns all partitions on the disk named \\.\PHYSICALDRIVE0.

maml:description.maml:para: Parses the prefetch files' binary structure and returns a Prefetch object.
The Get-Prefetch cmdlet parses the binary structure contained within the specified Prefech file. If a file is not specified, Get-Prefetch parses all .pf files in the C:\Windows\Prefetch directory.
The path of a Prefetch file to parse.
The path of a Prefetch file to parse.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example returns an array of all Prefetch files in the C:\Windows\Prefetch directory.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
Get-Prefetch C:\Windows\Prefetch\CMD.EXE-89305D47.pf
Version : WINDOWS_8 Name : CMD.EXE Path : \DEVICE\HARDDISKVOLUME1\WINDOWS\SYSTEM32\CMD.EXE PathHash : 89305D47 DependencyCount : 25 PrefetchAccessTime : {4/3/2015 4:29:25 AM, 4/3/2015 4:29:18 AM, 3/31/2015 12:33:17 PM, 3/31/2015 12:22:42 PM...} DeviceCount : 1 RunCount : 40

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example parses the Prefetch file specified by the Path parameter.

maml:description.maml:para: Returns a Timezone object for the system.
The Get-Timezone cmdlet returns System.CurrentSystemTimeZone object for the system.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
Get-TimeZone
StandardName DaylightName ------------ ------------ Central Standard Time Central Daylight Time

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example returns a System.CurrentSystemTimeZone object, which contains the Standard Timezone and the Daylight Savings Timezone.

maml:description.maml:para: Parses the Volume Boot Record.
The Get-VolumeBootRecord reads the first 512 bytes (first sector) of the Logical Volume, also known as the Volume Boot Record, and parses its data structure to return a VolumeBootRecord object.
The name of the Volume or Logical Partition (Ex. \\.\C:, \\.\HARDDISKVOLUME1, or C).
The name of the Volume or Logical Partition (Ex. \\.\C:, \\.\HARDDISKVOLUME1, or C).

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
Get-VolumeBootRecord -VolumeName C
Signature : NTFS BytesPerSector : 512 SectorsPerCluster : 8 ReservedSectors : 0 MediaDescriptor : 248 SectorsPerTrack : 63 NumberOfHeads : 255 HiddenSectors : 2048 TotalSectors : 125825023 LCN_MFT : 786432 LCN_MFTMirr : 2 ClustersPerFileRecord : 246 ClustersPerIndexBlock : 1 VolumeSN : E3133CD4233CD4CA Code : {0, 0, 0, 0...}

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example shows how to get the VolumeBootRecord object for the C drive.

maml:description.maml:para: Make a byte for byte copy of a file, disk, or partition.
The Invoke-DD cmdlet functions in the same manner as the popular dd utility. This cmdlet will make an exact clone of a file, and output it to the specified OutFile.
The file to read from. (Ex. \\.\PHYSICALDRIVE0, \\.\HARDDISKVOLUME1, or \\.\C:)
The file to write the copied bytes to.
The byte offset to begin reading from.
The number of bytes to read/write at a time. If reading from a device (Ex. \\.\PHYSICALDRIVE0 or \\.\C:) BlockSize must be divisible by 512 (1 sector). The size of The default value is 512.
The number of blocks to read from "InFile".
The file to read from. (Ex. \\.\PHYSICALDRIVE0, \\.\HARDDISKVOLUME1, or \\.\C:)
The file to write the copied bytes to.
The byte offset to begin reading from.
The number of bytes to read/write at a time. If reading from a device (Ex. \\.\PHYSICALDRIVE0 or \\.\C:) BlockSize must be divisible by 512 (1 sector). The size of The default value is 512.
The number of blocks to read from "InFile".

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example shows Invoke-DD being used to copy the first 512 bytes (first sector or the Master Boot Record) from the disk \\.\PHYSICALDRIVE0 and outputting it to the path specified by the OutFile parameter.
